article.headline: Prairie View 51, Grambling 47
article.story: PRAIRIE VIEW, Texas (AP) -- Marlon Davis hit the go-ahead 3-pointer with 34 seconds left as Prairie View A&M defeated Grambling State 51-47 Saturday night. Oscar Thompson scored 11 points and Phillip Scott had 10 for Prairie View A&M (2-11, 2-2 Southwestern Athletic Conference). Jamar Lewis had 13 points and Brion Rush chipped in with 12 for Grambling State (5-7, 2-3). Thompson hit a jumper to tie the game at 45 with 1:20 left. Davis, who scored his team's last six points, followed with a 3-pointer that put the Panthers ahead for good. Davis also hit three free throws in the final minute. The Panthers led 35-27 with 12:08 remaining, but the Tigers went on a 11-2 surge over the next four minutes to take the lead. Neither team had more than a five-point advantage the rest of the way.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
